Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sibling is recruiting for Generative AI Data Scientist. We’re offering a 12-month contract in Brussels to help drive digital transformation through cutting-edge enterprise AI solutions.

You’ll design and deploy advanced Generative AI tools (e.g., coding assistants, retrieval systems), leveraging LLMs and modern AI frameworks in a collaborative environment.




12months+ Contract

English, French or Dutch Advantageus




Requirements




MS/PhD in CS, EE, Stats, or related
Strong applied ML (regression, classification, etc.)
Proficiency in Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, LangChain
Experience with GPT, VAE, GANs, embeddings, transformers
Skilled in NLP, Prompt Engineering & system design
Independent, innovative, and a strong communicator
Bonus if you’ve built LLM-powered agents or scalable agent frameworks.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer - Brussels - ASAP Start - Freelance/CDI
Description:
Company Description

Machine Learning Engineers promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the ML&AI community. They do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.

Job Description

They participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means they contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

ML Engineers are meant to facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.

ML Engineers contribute to Machine Learning projects by:


Working with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity, …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry, …)
Contributing to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests, …)
Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment


Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.

Additional Information

Technical Experience Required:


Containerization / virtualisation
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
postgresql
Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT / ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are currently looking for a “Data Scientist” to strengthen the Cronos Europa team.


This position requires a maximum of 5 days per month at client offices. However, teleworking must take place within 2 hours of Brussels.


Responsabilities:

  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units’ business needs;
  • Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects developed.


Technical skills:

  • Data Analytics techniques and tools.
  • Power BI (including Power Query).
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, Other business intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS…), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory…).
  • SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
  • Architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems.


Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree minimum
  • English fluent
  • Ability to integrate in multicultural environment, team player, discretion, integrity, problem solving.


Why Cronos Group?

We’ll propose you:

  • An attractive salary package
  • A good work-life balance environment
  • The assurance of working in cutting-edge technologies in an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • The opportunity to develop your skills thanks to tailor-made training courses according to your needs
  • A good job in a friendly place

If you wish to integrate a dynamic structure on a human scale while working with the latest technologies, don't wait anymore and join Cronos!

Title: Software Engineer, Frontend
Description:
Joining Collibra’s Software Engineering Team

The Software Engineering team at Collibra is a team of builders around the world, characterized by a love for innovative technology, a desire to solve problems, and a never-ending goal to build simple, elegant products that delight customers and simplify all levels of data engagement.

Guided by Agile principles, the software engineering team leads with confidence, knowing that today’s problems require tomorrow’s solutions.

This is a hybrid role based in our Brussels office. Our hybrid model means you’ll work from the office at least two days each week. This setup helps us stay connected, work more closely together, and keep making progress as a team.

Frontend Engineers at Collibra are responsible for


Designing, developing and maintaining new features to further improve our products.
Establishing strong relationships across multiple teams to achieve results and partnering with others to implement new functionalities with an emphasis on quality.
Developing efficient clean code and serve as an expert in best practices for coding and help more junior members improve their practices.
Following the agile process (Scrum) to make sure your deliverables are visible for the entire team and company stakeholders.
Demonstrating results / functionality / change / recommendations.
Taking direct ownership of challenges found and working collaboratively through these with others by sharing your ideas.
Contribute in efforts to invent, design and build software that is both stable and meets customer objectives.


You have


Professional experience in building large and scalable web applications with Javascript, Typescript, CSS, HTML, React, Material UI and Jest.
Work experience in building products intended for real-time on-demand environments e.g. SaaS, Internet/Digital, or Cloud Products.
Knowledge of OO principles, Design Patterns, functional programming, clean code principles, and Agile processes (Scrum) in developing and delivering software.
Ability to communicate effectively in English - we’re a global team and English is the most spoken language.
Work experience with at least one of the following additional technologies: NX, Node, GraphQL/Restful APIs, ZOD, Playwright, Storybook/Chromatic, Accessibility/Internationalization.
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent related working experience is required.
This is a full time employment position. As of this time, we are not considering freelance or B2B arrangements for this role.
You must have work authorization to work in Brussels, Belgium.


You are


Interested in technology and the capability to adapt to new technologies.
Agile-minded, optimistic, passionate, and pragmatic about delivering valuable software to customers.
Someone who puts quality first and has a passion for good design and clean code.
Able to work productively with a geographically distributed remote team and able to mentor and advise other engineers you work with on the scrum team.
Empathetic to the customer’s needs with a strong desire to solve their problems.


Measures of success


Within your first month, you will get familiar with the environment we use, the way we implement software as an organization, simple business use cases and submit code to production.
Within your third month, you will implement new user stories with quality and care, and understand what value they will bring to our customers.
Within your sixth month, you will be a productive member, reliably delivering quality code, participating in testing and on your way to many interesting challenges and growth opportunities.


Benefits at Collibra

Collibra recognizes and values that everyone has different needs, interests, and life goals. We built our benefits program with flexibility in mind to support you and your loved ones through a diverse range of circumstances and life events. These flexible offerings sit on a foundation of competitive compensation, health coverage, and time off. Learn more about Collibra’s benefits.

We create inclusion and belonging through how we onboard, meet, connect, engage, and communicate. Learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion at Collibra.

At Collibra, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We realize the key to creating a company with a world-class culture and employee experience comes from who we hire and creating a workplace that celebrates everyone.

With this, we proudly consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, sex, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, HIV status, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status or any other legally protected category. If you have a need that requires accommodation, let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Company Intro


At Toloka AI we create data that powers leading GenAI models and innovations. We work with frontier labs, big tech, renowned AI startups, enterprises and non-profit research organizations worldwide. We use a combination of Experts + Crowd + Tech Platform to teach AI models to reason and evaluate their efficacy and safety. We have experts in more than 50 different domains—from doctors and lawyers to physicists and engineers—and boast one of the most diverse global crowds, representing over 100 countries and speaking 40+ languages. We are a well-funded startup with an enviable portfolio of clients including Anthropic, Amazon, Microsoft, poolside, Recraft, and Shopify.


Recently, we secured strategic investment led by Bezos Expeditions with participation from Mikhail Parakhin, CTO of Shopify and board advisor to leading GenAI companies, who now serves as our Chairman of the Board. Our remote-first team is globally distributed around the world: USA, UK, the Netherlands, Israel, Czech Republic, Serbia, and more. We are headquartered in Amsterdam.


About the role


We believe the future of work lies in effective AI–human collaboration, not in purely autonomous systems operating on their own.


That’s why we’re building Hybrid Agents – systems where AI and human experts work side-by-side, solve tasks together, and leverage each other’s strengths. From general-purpose tasks to highly specialized professional domains, our platform unites people and models, backed by state-of-the-art technology and a growing marketplace of expert talent.


As an AI/ML Engineer, you will be a core contributor to the AI layer of our product.


What You’ll Work On


  • Build agentic systems and develop skills such as search, browsing, coding, and more;
  • Design and experiment with hybrid-execution mechanics, including human hand-off and result validation;
  • Develop automated evaluations that measure system quality on real-world tasks;
  • Research and integrate state-of-the-art techniques to improve core quality and agent skills;
  • Develop and maintain production services;
  • Contribute to agent infrastructure – tools, environments, and third-party integrations.


Qualifications


  • 3+ years of industry experience in machine learning;
  • Solid understanding of how modern deep-learning models work, including their strengths and limitations;
  • Experience developing software and building products with language models;
  • Strong engineering skills with proficiency in Python and commonly used ML frameworks;
  • Proven track record of delivering ML-driven products.


Preferred but not required


  • Experience building complex agentic systems;
  • Experience designing or implementing evaluation metrics;
  • Contributions to ML research projects;
  • Fluency in English.


What we can offer


  • You’ll have the opportunity to work on highly innovative, projects at the leading edge of AI development, and work with a genuinely dedicated and dynamic team of experts;
  • You’ll also be working on projects with customers that are AI industry leaders and household names;
  • Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
  • Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
  • Paid parental leave and sick leave;
  • 25 vacation days per year.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are Remobi - We empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high performing, high quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.




Job Title: Data Scientist

Duration: Until the end of September 2025 (With the possibility of being extended)

Position Type: Freelance/Contract/B2B




Responsibilities:




Develop and maintain machine learning models, including but not limited to, predictive models, natural language processing models, and computer vision models.
Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning solutions.
Develop algorithms and statistical models to optimize machine learning models and improve their accuracy.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advances in machine learning and data science.




Expected Skills & Capabilities




Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and neural networks.
Understanding and experience with AWS SageMaker
Background working closely with Snowflake
Experience with cloud-based machine learning platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.
Excellent analytical skills and profound expertise in the application of statistical modeling
Demonstrate excellent programming skills in Python & SQL as well as good skills in related analytical libraries.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Extensive experience with infrastructure as a code (IAC), particularly with AWS CDK.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US




Konecta is a leading innovative global service provider in customer management business process and digital outsourcing, with 120,000 passionate employees working in 30 languages across 4 continents and 26 countries. Focusing on the unique needs and opportunities of each industry, Konecta offers a full range of end-to-end customer management solutions – including acquisition, retention, customer service, technical support, and collection – all based on a sustainable business model. These services are built on a portfolio of world-class expertise covering customer experience and process management, digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies. Headquartered in Madrid, Konecta delivers global revenues of €2 billion with more than 500 clients, covering some of the biggest names in telecoms, energy, banking, mobility, retail, and e-commerce.




MISSION OF THE ROLE




The Data Scientist in Advisory & Professional Services plays a key role in designing and implementing generative AI solutions that solve real business problems. Working closely with senior data scientists, consultants, and engineers, this role supports the development of prototypes, PoVs, and client-facing solutions using state-of-the-art AI models, agentic frameworks and techniques. The ideal candidate combines hands-on technical ability with curiosity and the drive to create business value through data.




RESPONSIBILITIES




Technical Delivery:

Assist in designing and building Gen AI prototypes using LLMs, embeddings, RAG pipelines, and fine-tuning techniques.
Develop and test agentic workflows using frameworks like LangChain Agents, CrewAI, AutoGen, or Databricks Mosaic AI
Support feature engineering, evaluation, and testing of models in collaboration with architects and engineers.
Create clean, reusable code and Jupyter notebooks that align with internal quality and documentation standards.




Client Collaboration:

Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and technical validation phases.
Translate client needs into tractable data science tasks and communicate results clearly.
Collaborate with squads to continuously refine agent behavior, planning strategies, and tool integrations
Support the presentation of prototypes and findings in pre-sales and advisory engagements.




Reusability & Innovation:

Contribute to internal libraries, prompt collections, evaluation frameworks, and demo environments.
Help maintain Gen AI accelerator kits and continuously refine based on project experience.




Governance & Compliance:

Apply responsible AI principles including explainability, fairness, and auditability in project work.
Ensure alignment with the AI governance framework, especially regarding EU AI Act and data protection.




REQUIREMENTS

3–5 years of experience in data science or applied machine learning, preferably in a consulting or client-facing environment.
Hands-on experience with LLM APIs, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt engineering.
Skilled in Python and ML libraries such as LangChain, Hugging Face, scikit-learn, Pandas, and Jupyter.
Familiarity with MLOps concepts and tools like MLflow, DVC, or cloud-based model deployment (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Able to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfortable working with REST APIs, event-driven architectures, and integrating external tools into agent workflows
A team player with an appetite for learning, co-creation, and working in multidisciplinary squads.
Awareness of ethical AI, responsible AI practices, and data privacy guidelines.
Fluent English
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector – Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients — a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)— we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Show more

  • Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
  • Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
  • Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
  • Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.


Profile Sought

  • Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
  • Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
  • Excellent command of Python.
  • Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
  • Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
  • Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required


Nice to Have

  • Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
  • Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
  • Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
  • Knowledge of GPU computing environments.


Offer

  • Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
  • Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
  • Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
  • Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
  • Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
  • Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI/ML Engineer




Location: Remote (Europe based)




Industry: Life Sciences Quality Management SaaS




About Us: We are a SaaS company specializing in innovative quality management systems (QMS) tailored for the life sciences sector. Our mission is to ensure compliance, enhance quality processes, and improve operational efficiency through cutting-edge technology and AI-driven analytics.




Role Overview: We are seeking an experienced AI/ML Engineer to join our AI & Data Analytics team. You will lead and contribute to impactful projects that leverage advanced machine learning, analytics techniques, and large language models (LLMs). Your primary responsibility will involve designing, developing, and deploying AI-powered features to enhance our platform's capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models, including applications involving large language models (LLMs), to enhance product capabilities.
Analyze structured and unstructured data, including text-based documents and event records.
Conduct data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
Utilize semantic search techniques, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) methods, and advanced LLM-based frameworks.
Collaborate with product managers, software developers, and quality assurance teams to integrate and deploy AI features.
Monitor, evaluate, and optimize model performance continuously.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields.
3+ years of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or related roles.
Proficiency in Python and key libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas, and NumPy.
Experience working with LLMs.
Experience in semantic search, document retrieval, text analytics, and prompt engineering.
Robust analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience processing regulatory documents, compliance texts, or technical documentation in regulated industries
Experience fine-tuning LLMs.
Prior experience within SaaS or life sciences sectors.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and machine learning deployment processes.
Knowledge of vector databases and modern AI application architectures.




Soft Skills:

Effective communication and collaboration abilities.
Ability to translate complex technical solutions into understandable insights for business stakeholders.
Proactive mindset, attention to detail, and commitment to quality outcomes.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, innovative environment with opportunities to work on cutting-edge technologies.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyse raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in relevant field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau, Power BI)

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Junior Data Scientist



Are you passionate about data and ready to turn insights into real business impact? In this role, you'll apply your analytical skills and creativity to develop smart models that enhance decision-making, improve customer experiences, and boost operational efficiency.



What will you do?



As a Junior Data Scientist, you'll be part of a dynamic Data & Analytics team. Your responsibilities include:

Building intelligent models: From predictive algorithms to AI-powered solutions - you'll create data products that directly support business goals.

Turning data into insight: You'll gather and analyze internal and external data and transform it into actionable insights for various departments.

Innovating continuously: You're always looking for new data sources, technologies, and methodologies to push boundaries and add value.

Bridging tech and business: You explain complex models in a clear, accessible way to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and confidently defend your approach.

Managing projects: You translate business or technical questions into structured data solutions, with well-defined deliverables and measurable KPIs.



Who are we looking for?



You're curious, analytical, and ready to launch (or boost) your career in data science. You have:

A master's degree in a relevant field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, AI, Computer Science, Psychology, Physics…)

Up to 2 years of experience in data science or artificial intelligence

A critical and solution-oriented mindset

A proactive, hands-on attitude

Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complexity



What's in it for you?



We offer you a challenging role in a forward-thinking organization that values innovation and personal growth. You'll benefit from:

A competitive salary tailored to your experience

Company car with fuel/charging card (via mobility budget)

Smartphone with subscription

Monthly net allowance and annual bonus

Meal vouchers

Comprehensive group insurance and optional hospitalization coverage

Staff discounts

Flexible hours and hybrid working options

Ongoing learning opportunities via training and coaching

Clear growth paths within a data-driven environment

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
💼Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

🌐Language: Fluent English; Dutch OR French is required.

📄 Work Authorization: Valid work permit or combined permit to work in Belgium is required

🔥Keywords: Python, Machine Learning , IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code) , AI platforms




🧠 About the Role

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who thrives at the intersection of data science and production engineering. You’ll play a key role in transforming ML models into scalable, production-ready solutions that deliver real business value.

🎯 What You’ll Do

Collaborate with Data Scientists to design ML solutions with production constraints in mind.
Build and automate ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD tools.
Deploy, monitor, and retrain models in production environments.
Ensure robust data flow, versioning, and model performance tracking.
Support IT teams in configuring and maintaining production infrastructure.
Promote best practices in ML engineering across teams.

🛠️ What You Bring

Must-Have Technical Skills
Python programming
Containerization (Docker, VMs)
CI/CD (e.g., GitLab CI)
AI platforms & IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code)
Code, model & data versioning
PostgreSQL
Dependency and package management

Nice-to-Have

Experience with distributed systems or mainframe integration
Model compression techniques
ETL/ELT tools
Big Data tools (e.g., Spark)
Data flow processing and visualization tools

💼 Business & Soft Skills

Agile methodology experience
Strong communication (written & verbal)
Detail-oriented and results-driven
Creative problem solver
Continuous learner with a proactive mindset
Open to feedback and innovation.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
50% on-site & 50% homeworking

Fluency in Dutch or French, and English is required.

MUST BE BASED IN BELGIUM




Are you an experienced Data Scientist with a passion for generative AI? This is your chance to take your career to the next level by working on innovative AI solutions.




Join the Artificial Intelligence team as a Senior Data Scientist in Brussels, where you will play a key role in building and deploying cutting-edge AI applications that enhance internal processes and empower teams across the organisation. This position is based in brussels, with an initial contract running to 31st December 2025.




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement AI applications such as virtual assistants to address complex business challenges.
Apply advanced analytical techniques including generative AI approaches like Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning, speech-to-text, agentic systems, and image generation.
Use traditional statistical and machine learning methods where appropriate.
Leverage strong Python programming skills to develop and deploy AI solutions using a robust stack of tools.
Present key findings and insights to senior stakeholders.
Work with one of the most comprehensive and diverse datasets in the industry.
Contribute to a culture that encourages innovation, lean processes, and transparent communication.
Collaborate within an Agile team that values expertise sharing and continuous learning.




Skills and Experience Required

Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Data Science or Analytics.
Solid proficiency in Python, deep learning, and working with pre-trained models.
Preferred experience with platforms and tools such as Domino, Git, Langchain, and Haystack.
Strong interest in applying generative AI to the financial domain.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
A proactive, independent work style with a results-driven mindset.
Ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced, multicultural environment.
Fluent in Dutch or French.
Fluent in English.




This is an excellent opportunity for a dedicated Data Scientist eager to contribute to impactful AI initiatives in a collaborative and technologically advanced setting. Apply now or email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Contract Opportunity: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer – Energy Flexibility Focus




We're currently supporting a major player in the European energy market on a long-term data science project focused on implicit flexibility and system balancing.

This role is ideal for a Data Scientist with strong analytical and machine learning skills, preferably with prior exposure to the energy or electricity sector.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop advanced tracking methods to measure implicit reactions to price signals.
Analyse relationships between renewable forecasts, pricing, market behaviour, and system imbalances.
Build models to understand, predict, and assess flexibility within energy systems.
Produce actionable insights for operational and strategic decisions.
Collaborate with internal teams and stakeholders to support broader flexibility initiatives.




Key Requirements:

Minimum 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist.
Minimum 5 years of experience in Python programming.
Proficiency with statistical methods and machine learning models.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to convert business problems into quantitative analysis.
Experience working with large datasets in a production environment.
Understanding of electricity markets and energy systems is highly desirable.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Fluent in English; Dutch and/or French is a strong plus.




Details:

Location: Brussels (hybrid, ~2 days/week onsite)
Duration: Until 31st December 2025
Start: ASAP

This role is ideal for a Data Scientist with strong analytical and machine learning skills, preferably with prior exposure to the energy or electricity sector.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop advanced tracking methods to measure implicit reactions to price signals.
  • Analyse relationships between renewable forecasts, pricing, market behaviour, and system imbalances.
  • Build models to understand, predict, and assess flexibility within energy systems.
  • Produce actionable insights for operational and strategic decisions.
  • Collaborate with internal teams and stakeholders to support broader flexibility initiatives.


Key Requirements:

  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Python programming.
  • Proficiency with statistical methods and machine learning models.
  • Strong analytical mindset with the ability to convert business problems into quantitative analysis.
  • Experience working with large datasets in a production environment.
  • Understanding of electricity markets and energy systems is highly desirable.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
  • Fluent in English; Dutch and/or French is a strong plus.


Details:

  • Location: Brussels (hybrid, ~2 days/week onsite)
  • Duration: Until 31st December 2025
  • Start: ASAP

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer – 12 Months

Location: Brussels Hybrid (50% on-site) | Sector: Banking | Start: ASAP




A major banking institution is seeking a Freelance Machine Learning Engineer to help industrialize AI solutions by developing production-grade pipelines and ensuring seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.




Role Overview

You’ll collaborate with data scientists and IT teams to deliver scalable, reliable, and automated ML services. This includes designing infrastructure-aware solutions, automating workflows, and ensuring robust integration with existing systems.




Key Responsibilities

Co-design ML solutions with data scientists, taking production constraints into account
Automate and deploy ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD best practices
Implement model and data versioning, testing frameworks, and performance monitoring
Act as a technical bridge between AI teams and IT operations for deployment and maintenance
Ensure models are monitored, retrained when needed, and integrated with business metrics




Mandatory Skills

4+ years of experience in ML engineering or related roles
Strong Python development and CI/CD experience (e.g., GitLab CI)
Hands-on with containerization/virtualization (Docker, VMs)
Proficient in data/model/code versioning and dependency management
Experience with PostgreSQL and related tooling
Fluent in English; working proficiency in French or Dutch is a PLUS
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and collaborative delivery




Nice to Have

Familiarity with Spark, ETL/ELT workflows, and data flow orchestration
Knowledge of legacy systems integration and hybrid infrastructure
Experience with model compression, performance tuning, or data visualization tools

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer - Brussels - ASAP Start - Freelance/CDI
Description:
Machine Learning Engineers promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the ML&AI community. They do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.





Job Description



They participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means they contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

ML Engineers are meant to facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.







ML Engineers contribute to Machine Learning projects by:



Working with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity, …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry, …)
Contributing to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests, …)
Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment



Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.





Additional Information



Technical Experience Required:



Containerization / virtualisation
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
postgresql





Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT / ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you a data scientist with a passion for the energy transition? Want to contribute to the development of smart, sustainable solutions in the Belgian and European energy sector? Then we have an exciting assignment for you.




We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a mission at a leading player in the electricity transmission sector, focused on implicit flexibility and optimizing demand response based on price incentives.




🧠 About the Assignment




You’ll join the Market Energy Solutions department, within a team responsible for:

designing the balancing model of the electricity system,
defining the imbalance pricing mechanism,
and the related processes, terms & internal communication.




Your focus will be to develop data-driven methods to track how market actors react to price signals ("implicit flexibility")—for example, how energy consumption patterns change in response to price fluctuations or system imbalances.




The insights you generate will directly improve market design, support policy decisions, and fuel innovation in flexible energy use.




🔧 Your Responsibilities




Mapping available flexibility via research, interviews, data analysis, and estimation techniques;
Developing models and analyses to assess the relationship between price signals, system imbalances, and market behavior;
Linking three layers of flexibility:
Installed (e.g. physical assets like EVs),
Available (price-responsive capacity),
Effectively activated (real changes in energy consumption/injection);
Collaborating with other departments to share findings and apply results more broadly.




You may also be involved in other ongoing data science projects within the implicit flexibility team as needed.




✅ Your Profile




📊 Data Science & Modeling

Minimum 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist
5+ years of Python programming
Hands-on with statistics and machine learning on large datasets
Strong analytical thinker who can structure complex questions into actionable models

⚡ Energy Sector Knowledge

Understanding of how energy markets function
Experience in the electricity market is a strong asset

💡 Soft Skills

Able to manage multiple types of tasks autonomously, from operational to conceptual
Detail-oriented, but with a helicopter view
Strong communication and problem-solving skills
Languages: fluent in English, ideally also Dutch and/or French




🎯 Why This Role?

You’ll work on real-world challenges that support the energy transition
Be part of a cross-functional team where data science, market design, and sustainability intersect
Apex Consulting offers professional support, transparency, and a long-term vision for your freelance or consulting career




📍 Location: Brussels – hybrid work setup

📅 Start: ASAP

💼 Contract: Freelance or permanent through Apex Consulting

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Build the Future of AI




Are you ready to push the boundaries of what's possible?

Join us as a Machine Learning Engineer and dive into cutting-edge projects that transform industries. From fine-tuning generative models to creating robust MLOps pipelines, you’ll work on real-world AI systems that matter.




This isn’t just another ML role—it’s your chance to work with global leaders on impactful, boundary-pushing AI projects. Collaborate with experts, innovate in production, and make a real-world difference.




What You'll Be Doing:

Architect and deploy machine learning models into production
Develop MLOps pipelines (CI/CD, versioning, monitoring)
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to turn prototypes into scalable solutions
Optimize model performance, reliability, and latency
Stay ahead of the curve by experimenting with new ML frameworks and libraries




What You'll Bring:

Expertise in Python and ML frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow
Hands-on experience with MLOps tooling (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow)
Proven track record deploying ML models on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong foundations in data structures, algorithms, and model optimization
Excellent communication skills—you can translate complex tech to business value




It Would Be Great If You Had:

Experience with Generative AI, NLP, computer vision, or reinforcement learning
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
Background scaling infrastructure for high-traffic, AI-powered applications




Why Join Us?




The demand for ML talent has exploded—this is your moment.

If you're ready to shape the future, apply now or tag someone who should be on our radar!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.
Show more

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.







Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.







Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR…)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo
w).Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AW
S).Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring too
ls.Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KP
Is.Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaborati
on.Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholde
rs.Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applicatio
ns.Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitude

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focussed
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks




Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fi

eld.2–6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Penta Consulting are a technology service provider and industry-leading outsourced partner. We've specialised in providing professional and managed services to OEMs, system integrators, and financial services providers globally as well as IT and Telco companies for over 26 years.




We are in search of an AI Engineer to work fully remote in the EU. This is going to be a 9 Month Contract.




We are seeking a talented AI Engineer to join our dynamic team and contribute to the creation of state-of-the-art AI solutions. The role focuses on developing and deploying AI applications using tools such as Azure AI Studio, vector databases and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) frameworks, while working closely with the senior team members.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop and implement AI Solutions using python, with a focus on LLM's
Integrate AI models with Azure AI Studio, SharePoint and Azure Blob Storage
Build, test, and optimize RAG applications, leveraging eTective prompt engineering techniques




Qualifications:

Title: Computer Scientist- Python and SQL Programmer
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Python and SQL programmer to optimize and extend a production data analysis tool. This role involves refining an existing Python script, consolidating distributed JSON files into an efficient data store, and integrating analytics into a Qt-based application with graphical reporting capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Debug and enhance a Python script used for analyzing production data, specifically resolving issues related to die location within wafers.
Design and implement a structured, scalable database using SQL or Parquet formats to support fast querying and large dataset handling.
Generate graph-rich, insightful reports that communicate key production trends and metrics.
Embed the data analysis and reporting functionality into an existing Python/Qt application through a robust API.
Optimize for performance to ensure smooth handling of large volumes of data




Location: Leuven, Flemish Region, Belgium




Required Skills and Qualifications

Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL
Strong experience with data mining and manipulation of large datasets
Familiarity with data formats such as JSON and Parquet
Experience with graphical reporting libraries (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
Knowledge of Qt for Python (PyQt or PySide)
Exposure to JMP or Machine Learning techniques is a plus




We Offer

We provide a dynamic and rewarding temporary assignment where you'll work on meaningful, high-impact technology. You'll be part of a collaborative team striving to solve complex challenges and push the boundaries of what’s possible. A dynamic and multidisciplinary community dedicated to shaping the technologies of the future
Assignment Type: Full-time.
Work Schedule: 40 hours per week
Hybrid working model: combine remote work with in-office collaboration
The role provides flexibility, responsibility, and the chance to shape a product from the ground up
Supportive and flexible work culture promoting a healthy work-life balance

Title: Data Scientist - Electricity
Description:
ACENSI is looking for a Data Scientist - Electricity for one of their clients based in Brussels :




Service description :

Your primary task will be to develop and implement advanced methods for tracking implicit reactions (to the imbalance price). You will employ data analytics, machine learning models, and other quantitative approaches to understand and predict energy usage patterns. Your expertise in data science will be pivotal in designing algorithms that accurately capture the dynamics of implicit flexibility, offering actionable insights for optimizing energy consumption across various sectors.

By developing reliable tracking mechanisms, you will provide essential data that can be used to assess the effectiveness of implicit flexibility strategies, guide policy decisions, and improve system operations. Your contributions will directly influence the flexibility product design, helping stakeholders understand the value of implicit flexibility and drive innovation in energy solutions.




The main tasks expected are :

gathering information on available flexibility through various channels (desktop research, interviews, data analysis, estimation methods) ;
developing and conducting data analyses to determine the relationship between renewable energy forecasts, price information, market player behavior and system imbalances;
connecting the various elements to get a total view of the installed (related to the hardware, e.g. electric cars), available (able to react on price), and the effectively activated flexibility in the system (observed modification of the injection/consumption profile following a price);
connecting possible applications for different departments and disseminating the results internally ;




Various data science initiatives are running in the team, therefore it could be possible that you would be involved in some other related activities in the ‘implicit flexibility’ team, in case of needs.




Requirements :

Quantitative skills
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist with min. 5 years’ experience in Python programming
a strong, analytical mind and able to master and understand complex processes.
able to translate a question into a quantitative analysis or approach. You are strongly driven by facts and figures and you are able to support your reasoning in a clear way using quantitative results.
sufficient knowledge and experience regarding statistical methods (e.g. machine learning) to perform analysis on large data sets ;
Energy sector skills
understand the global workings of the energy market and preferably have several years of experience in the electricity market.
Other skills
can combine different types of tasks (from operational to conceptual) and organize yourself autonomously around different tasks. You can distinguish priorities well.
Quick learner, with a proactive and positive attitude. focus on details without losing sight of the overall picture and deliver flawless work.
take steering action within a project, also with a view to concrete implementation.
Fluently in English orally and in writing. Preferably fluent in Dutch and/or French
like teamwork, results-oriented and able to solve problems. A fluent communication style.







Additional information :

Location : Empereur (Keizerslaan 20 Brussel)
Work regime : About 2 days per week on site is desired
End date : 31/12/2025




Important : for non-EU candidates, please present candidates who comply with the following criteria :

Possess a work permit allowing the individual to work in Belgium.
Hold a valid residence permit confirming the right of residence in Belgium.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
In het AI & Analytics Solutions-team willen we ervoor zorgen dat we slimme besluitvorming (menselijke augmentatie of geautomatiseerd) naar de voorgrond van onze processen/reizen brengen door een data- en experimenteercultuur op te bouwen die uiteindelijk een concurrentievoordeel kan worden in de snel veranderende wereld van vandaag.

Wil je betrokken raken en een competitief ML Data Product bouwen? Ben je enthousiast om zakelijke waarde uit data te creëren?

Als lid van het AI&Analytics Solutions-team richt je je op het uitwerken van oplossingen met behulp van technologieën op het gebied van Big Data en AI (ML). Je zult nauw samenwerken met de Data Scientists en een actieve rol spelen in innovatietrajecten bij AXA. Je zult Proofs of Concept uitvoeren met behulp van Data Analytics en Machine Learning-technieken. Je zult ook ondersteuning bieden voor de industrialisatie van modellen en hun implementatie in productie, waarbij je best practices toepast die de evolutie van code en modelleringsmethoden (MLOps) mogelijk maken.

Als Machine Learning Engineer:

  • Werk je nauw samen en ondersteun je de Data Scientists van het team;
  • Ontwerp en implementeer je ML-systemen;
  • Pas je MLOps-principes toe langs de end-to-end pipeline;
  • Pas je best practices toe om herbruikbare activa te ontwikkelen binnen de volledige reikwijdte van AXA.

Profiel

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring

Als Machine Learning Engineer heb je:

  • Een masterdiploma in engineering of IT;
  • Hands-on ervaring met Python en cloud computing;
  • Kennis van AWS Sagemaker, AWS Lambda, AWS Glue, Step Functions,…
  • Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van end-to-end oplossingen;
  • Notie van Machine Learning, Statistiek en Optimalisatie;
  • Kennis van het Frans of Nederlands en zeer goede kennis van het Engels.

En je bent ook:

  • Resultaatgericht;
  • In staat om te ontwikkelen op het snijvlak van zakelijke behoeften en de technische aspecten van nieuwe technologieën;
  • Leergierig en bereid om te leren van de ervaring van je collega's;
  • Bereid om Machine Learning-algoritmes te testen en toe te passen op echte use-cases;
  • Uitzonderlijke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden;
  • In staat om problemen te identificeren en proactief op te lossen;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden;
  • In staat om in een team te werken.

AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden: Customer first, Integrity, Courage en One AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als één team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons Diversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten. 

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.

Title: Python AI Developer
Description:
Senior Python (AI) Developer: Generative AI Projects

Remote: Europe

Start Date: ASAP




Our client, a global leader in data-driven enterprise solutions, is seeking Senior Python (AI) Developers to drive innovation across their AI initiatives. Focused on revolutionising workflows in tax, audit, and risk management through Generative AI (GenAI), this role supports the world’s largest companies in optimising decision-making and data processes.




This is a remote-first role open to candidates across Europe with mandatory overlap between 2 PM – 6 PM CET to collaborate with US-based teams.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain scalable backend services using Python, FastAPI, and modern frameworks.
Design and implement secure, robust RESTful APIs for seamless integration with frontend systems and third-party services.
Leverage Azure Cloud infrastructure including Azure Functions and Azure Storage for scalable application deployment.
Build GenAI applications using frameworks such as LangChain, LangGraph, LlamaIndex, and vector databases.
Apply Prompt Engineering techniques and work with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) models.
Containerize applications using Docker and follow best practices for environment management and deployment.
Ensure secure coding practices, including implementation of OAuth/JWT authentication mechanisms.




Required Skills & Experience

Expert-level proficiency in Python for backend development.
Hands-on experience with FastAPI, Pandas, NumPy, and RESTful API development.
Solid knowledge of GenAI concepts, including RAG pipelines, prompt engineering, and embedding models.
Practical experience with LangChain, LangGraph, LlamaIndex, and vector databases.
Strong understanding of Azure Cloud Services, especially Azure Functions and Azure Storage.
Proficient in asynchronous programming for high-performance applications.
Familiarity with Docker for containerization and deployment.
Strong grasp of security best practices in API development (OAuth, JWT).




Preferred Qualifications

Awareness of AI ethics, bias mitigation, and responsible AI design.
Experience with multi-agent frameworks (e.g. CrewAI, Autogen, Taskweave).
Understanding of data engineering principles including pipelines, integration, and warehousing.
Performance tuning via monitoring and profiling tools.
Proficiency in unit testing and automation using PyTest or Unittest.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines for continuous deployment.

Title: 21001646 Auxiliar de Jarabes I (temporal)
Description:
Descripción de la empresa

Somos una compañía comercializadora de bebidas y alimentos con 137 años de experiencia y operaciones en Centroamérica, el Caribe y Sudamérica. Contamos con el portafolio de productos más grande de la región y trabajamos junto a nuestros socios estratégicos Pepsico, Ambev y Beliv ofreciendo soluciones innovadoras a nuestros clientes.

En CBC sabemos construir vínculos sólidos y duraderos. Sabemos escuchar a los consumidores para entender sus necesidades y ofrecerles las mejores marcas en las distintas ocasiones de consumo.

Llevamos sabor y frescura al mundo con la ambición de convertirnos en una compañía multicategoría que siga expandiendo sus horizontes. Lo hacemos con el entusiasmo de ver sonreír a nuestro equipo, a los nuestros y a quienes disfrutan lo que hacemos.

Nuestra cultura y energía transformadora tienen a la pasión como el motor que nos impulsa a ser mejores y a conquistar nuevos desafíos. Trabajamos con el disfrute de hacer juntos lo imposible.

Descripción del empleo

De qué se trata el puesto


Apoyar en la operación y preparación del jarabe para la línea de producción de acuerdo con el Programa de establecido con el fin de asegurar que se alcanzan los volúmenes definidos y que se cumplan con las especificaciones de calidad e inocuidad y lineamientos de seguridad.


Los retos del puesto


Apoyar la operación de los equipos y en la formulación de jarabe para abastecer a la línea de producción, asegurando el cumplimiento diario en tiempo y volumen del Programa.
Apoyar a los Operadores de Jarabes en actividades varias y necesarias para cumplir con el Programa de Producción.
Apoyar en el mantenimiento autónomo de los equipos del área en actividades de lubricación, limpieza, inspección y reapriete.
Cumplir con los estándares de Eficiencia, Buenas Prácticas de Manufactura, Inocuidad, Ambiente, Seguridad Industrial y Manufactura de Clase Mundial, con el fin de aprobar las auditorias AIB, WCM, Ministerio de Salud, Medio Ambiente y Normas de Seguridad.


Requisitos

¿A quién buscamos?


Autorización de jefe inmediato
Bachiller industrial o perito en electricidad
Disponibilidad para laborar turnos rotativos
Residir en Suchitepéquez, Retalhuleu o lugares aledaños


Información adicional

Descripción breve

OPERATIVO

Competencias


Impacto en el entorno - Enfoque al cliente
Transformo el negocio
Soy emprendedor
Potencio el aprendizaje
Desarrollo el talento
Soluciono problemas
Lograr resultados - Organización y disciplina
Buscar soluciones - Pensamiento analítico y estructurado
Fomentar la cooperación - Influencia y trabajo en equipo
Buscar soluciones - Perspectiva de negocio y visión estratégica
Lograr resultados - Orientación al logro y disciplina
Liderar equipos - Liderazgo ético
Fomentar la cooperación - Adaptación al cambio
Lograr resultados - Innovación e iniciativa
Lograr resultados - Innovación
Liderar equipos - Desarrollo de gente
Impacto en el entorno - Desarrollo de Relaciones


La misión de Grupo Mariposa es fomentar el crecimiento y la sostenibilidad dentro de la industria global de alimentos y bebidas. Estamos comprometidos con la excelencia a través de una gestión disciplinada, prácticas innovadoras y una cultura dinámica que acepta el cambio.
