  • Apoyar en la operación y preparación del jarabe para la línea de producción de acuerdo con el Programa de establecido con el fin de asegurar que se alcanzan los volúmenes definidos y que se cumplan con las especificaciones de calidad e inocuidad y lineamientos de seguridad.

Los retos del puesto

  • Apoyar la operación de los equipos y en la formulación de jarabe para abastecer a la línea de producción, asegurando el cumplimiento diario en tiempo y volumen del Programa.
  • Apoyar a los Operadores de Jarabes en actividades varias y necesarias para cumplir con el Programa de Producción.
  • Apoyar en el mantenimiento autónomo de los equipos del área en actividades de lubricación, limpieza, inspección y reapriete.
  • Cumplir con los estándares de Eficiencia, Buenas Prácticas de Manufactura, Inocuidad, Ambiente, Seguridad Industrial y Manufactura de Clase Mundial, con el fin de aprobar las auditorias AIB, WCM, Ministerio de Salud, Medio Ambiente y Normas de Seguridad.

Requisitos

¿A quién buscamos?

  • Autorización de jefe inmediato
  • Bachiller industrial o perito en electricidad
  • Disponibilidad para laborar turnos rotativos
  • Residir en Suchitepéquez, Retalhuleu o lugares aledaños

Información adicional

Descripción breve

OPERATIVO

Competencias

  • Impacto en el entorno - Enfoque al cliente
  • Transformo el negocio
  • Soy emprendedor
  • Potencio el aprendizaje
  • Desarrollo el talento
  • Soluciono problemas
  • Lograr resultados - Organización y disciplina
  • Buscar soluciones - Pensamiento analítico y estructurado
  • Fomentar la cooperación - Influencia y trabajo en equipo
  • Buscar soluciones - Perspectiva de negocio y visión estratégica
  • Lograr resultados - Orientación al logro y disciplina
  • Liderar equipos - Liderazgo ético
  • Fomentar la cooperación - Adaptación al cambio
  • Lograr resultados - Innovación e iniciativa
  • Lograr resultados - Innovación
  • Liderar equipos - Desarrollo de gente
  • Impacto en el entorno - Desarrollo de Relaciones

La misión de Grupo Mariposa es fomentar el crecimiento y la sostenibilidad dentro de la industria global de alimentos y bebidas. Estamos comprometidos con la excelencia a través de una gestión disciplinada, prácticas innovadoras y una cultura dinámica que acepta el cambio.

Title: 21001872 Verificador de Bodega CD
Description:
Descripción de la empresa

Somos una compañía comercializadora de bebidas y alimentos con 137 años de experiencia y operaciones en Centroamérica, el Caribe y Sudamérica. Contamos con el portafolio de productos más grande de la región y trabajamos junto a nuestros socios estratégicos Pepsico, Ambev y Beliv ofreciendo soluciones innovadoras a nuestros clientes.

En CBC sabemos construir vínculos sólidos y duraderos. Sabemos escuchar a los consumidores para entender sus necesidades y ofrecerles las mejores marcas en las distintas ocasiones de consumo.

Llevamos sabor y frescura al mundo con la ambición de convertirnos en una compañía multicategoría que siga expandiendo sus horizontes. Lo hacemos con el entusiasmo de ver sonreír a nuestro equipo, a los nuestros y a quienes disfrutan lo que hacemos.

Nuestra cultura y energía transformadora tienen a la pasión como el motor que nos impulsa a ser mejores y a conquistar nuevos desafíos. Trabajamos con el disfrute de hacer juntos lo imposible.

Descripción del empleo

Verificar que todo producto que entra y sale de la bodega (abastecimientos y saldos vacíos) se encuentre en cantidades y condiciones óptimas, basados en las políticas y procesos institucionales, para garantizar el buen manejo del inventario

Requisitos

Finalidades especificas:


Realizar la correcta rotación de producto por medio de PEPS para evitar pérdidas por vencimiento.
Verificar la carga de camiones y cualquier otro despacho de producto para tener un control sobre el inventario.
Operar el sistema SAP para llevar registro de lo que entra y sale de la bodega y las bajas del producto fuera de norma.
Verificar que los Auxiliares de Bodega manejen de manera correcta el inventario para no dañar el producto.
Requisitos:
Autorización de tu jefe inmediato
Disponibilidad para laborar en jornada nocturna.
Graduado a nivel diversificado
Conocimiento y experiencia en bodega y manejo de inventarios.
Manejo de Office y sus programas. Ideal SAP


Información adicional

La misión de Grupo Mariposa es fomentar el crecimiento y la sostenibilidad dentro de la industria global de alimentos y bebidas. Estamos comprometidos con la excelencia a través de una gestión disciplinada, prácticas innovadoras y una cultura dinámica que acepta el cambio.

Title: Asesor (a) de Ventas (Sala y Ruta) - Tiquisate
Description:
Responsabilidades:


Identificar oportunidades de negocio en sala y durante la ruta, a clientes del sector de construcción y acabados.
Brindar asesoría técnica y seguimiento personalizado apoyando a clientes en sus proyectos.
Planificar y cumplir visitas a clientes asignados y prospectar nuevos clientes.
Mantener actualizada la información sobre productos, precios, promociones y lanzamientos.
Elaborar cotizaciones.


Requisitos:


Graduado(a) a nivel diversificado.
Experiencia mínima de 1 año en ventas en el sector de construcción, ferretería, acabados o similar.
Dominio intermedio de herramientas informáticas: Microsoft Office, hojas de cálculo.
Excelentes habilidades de negociación, comunicación asertiva y orientación al servicio.
Capacidad para trabajar tanto en sala como en campo.
Poseer moto propia en buen estado.
Poseer licencia de conducir vigente.
Residir en Tiquisate o zonas aledañas.


Ofrecemos:


Salario base de Q3,800.60 (bonificación incluida).
Atractiva esquema de comisiones.
En planilla con todas las prestaciones de ley.
Viáticos y apoyo para combustible.
Beneficios adicionales y oportunidades de capacitación.
Opción de horario: lunes a viernes de 7:00 a 16:00 horas o de 8:00 a 17:00 horas y sábado de 8:00 a 13:00 horas.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development – Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right – Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership – Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching – Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you’re excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hello Network!







I hope you're doing well today,







Role title : AI Software Engineer

Location : Zurich, Switzerland

Work model : 3 days WFO mandatory

Primary skill : Artificial General Intelligence

Secondary skill : Machine Learning







Role Definition:







This is a specialized role for an AI Software Engineer to design, build, and deploy scalable AI models
and systems. They work with machine learning frameworks, cloud platforms, and data engineering tools to create and optimize AI solutions.







Skills:







Proficient:







Languages/Framework: Fast API, Azure UI Search API (React)
Cloud: Azure Cloud Basics (Azure DevOps)
Gitlab: Gitlab Pipeline
Ansible and REX: Rex Deployment
Data Science: Prompt Engineering + Modern Testing
Understanding of AI/ML algorithms and their applications
MLOps frameworks
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure ML especially)
Model deployment process







• Expert: (in addition to proficient skills):







Languages/Framework: Azure Open AI
Data Science: Open AI GPT Family of models 4o/4/3, Embeddings + Vector Search
Databases and ETL: Azure Storage Account, Postgresql, Cosmos
Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Familiarity with distributed computing and big data tools (Spark, Hadoop)
Ability to optimize models for performance and scalability
Experience with Azure AI Search







If you are interested, or you know someone that could be please reach out and we can arrange a time to speak?

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
SamanTree Medical is an innovative Belgian-Swiss medical device company dedicated to improving patient care and operating room efficiency through breakthrough imaging technology. The company develops and manufactures the Histolog Scanner, an advanced imaging solution that enables real-time analysis of fresh tissue samples. This visualization modality supports a wide range of surgical and diagnostic applications. SamanTree Medical is actively commercializing the Histolog Scanner across Europe and the United States.




SamanTree is built on the passion and dedication of talented people from diverse backgrounds. We believe that breakthrough ideas can come from anywhere, so we foster a culture rooted in diversity, respect, and open-mindedness. Leading with inclusion, we empower our team members to bring their best, most authentic selves to work each day.




Our culture thrives on purpose-driven individuals who aspire to make a meaningful impact. Team members here are grounded in integrity, eager to learn, fueled by energy, and bring a wealth of diverse, real-world perspectives that drive innovative thinking. We’re committed to our people’s long-term growth, actively investing in their potential to advance our mission and inspire them to achieve their highest potential.




Join a team setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra-Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

For more information, please visit https://www.samantree.com/




To ensure the growth of SamanTree Medical, we are looking for:




Data Scientist, Lausanne (Switzerland)




In the R&D department, we are currently looking for a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. You will contribute to the development of digital products and extract meaningful insights from complex datasets, making them available to relevant teams to support data-driven decision-making and operational improvements.

Responsibilities

Developing deep sector-specific data expertise in confocal microscopy images, to actively contribute to data annotation activities and coordinate outsourced image annotation workflows
Selecting, organizing, managing, and preserving data to ensure its long-term value and accessibility for specific users or purposes
Interacting with colleagues from a cross-functional team on various data-related projects for understanding the needs for technical data solutions, defining solutions concepts and design, providing training and retrieving feedback.
Collaborating closely to the development of data analytics based components under design control, in accordance with ISO 13485 and FDA Quality System Regulations.
Conducting feasibility and proof-of-concept projects to further improve and standardize the performances, usability and adoption of SamanTree Medical’s products
Performing technical reviews and contributing to the development of test procedures of existing data processes




Skills, Qualifications and Experience

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
You are attentive to details and committed to maintaining data accuracy and quality.
You have experience in applying data science techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably on images. 1 to 3 years of experience in a similar position is a plus.
You are proficient in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
You are a strong team player with the ability to collaborate across interdisciplinary teams.
You communicate clearly and confidently in fluent English, both written and spoken; you communicate fluently in French (spoken).




At least one of the following applies to you :

You have a strong interest in data visualization and enjoy transforming data into clear, compelling visuals
You enjoy digging into databases of text and/or images until you find the answer to a complex data question
You are enthusiastic about AI and machine learning and have experience with training models on images




Our offer

A 100 % or 80 % job
Primarily on-site work (maximum 1 day homeworking per week)
An attractive and competitive salary package in line with your profile and experience
A challenging and diversified position within a high-potential fast-growing innovative medical device company.
A human-size, dynamic, respectful, and collaborative work environment
International exposure, with learning and development opportunities.
A role that directly contributes to the improvement of global healthcare outcomes




How to Apply

Please combine your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and language skills into a single document and submit it via the LinkedIn "CV upload" option.




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are all proud to work for such a great company as Samantree Medical. And we would be even prouder to have you on board. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, regardless of your race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Please apply if you see a position that makes your heartbeat, and if you feel the role is appealing to you. If you’re smart and good at what you do, come as you are.

SamanTree is an emerging company with significant potential in the MedTech sector. For individuals seeking challenges, SamanTree offers opportunities for growth both nationally and internationally. We value inquisitive and highly committed individuals who are dedicated to collaborating towards making SamanTree a success.




Join a team that’s setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

Show more

  • Collaborating closely to the development of data analytics based components under design control, in accordance with ISO 13485 and FDA Quality System Regulations.
  • Conducting feasibility and proof-of-concept projects to further improve and standardize the performances, usability and adoption of SamanTree Medical’s products
  • Performing technical reviews and contributing to the development of test procedures of existing data processes


Skills, Qualifications and Experience

  • You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
  • You are attentive to details and committed to maintaining data accuracy and quality.
  • You have experience in applying data science techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably on images. 1 to 3 years of experience in a similar position is a plus.
  • You are proficient in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
  • You are a strong team player with the ability to collaborate across interdisciplinary teams.
  • You communicate clearly and confidently in fluent English, both written and spoken; you communicate fluently in French (spoken).


At least one of the following applies to you :

  • You have a strong interest in data visualization and enjoy transforming data into clear, compelling visuals
  • You enjoy digging into databases of text and/or images until you find the answer to a complex data question
  • You are enthusiastic about AI and machine learning and have experience with training models on images


Our offer

  • A 100 % or 80 % job
  • Primarily on-site work (maximum 1 day homeworking per week)
  • An attractive and competitive salary package in line with your profile and experience
  • A challenging and diversified position within a high-potential fast-growing innovative medical device company.
  • A human-size, dynamic, respectful, and collaborative work environment
  • International exposure, with learning and development opportunities.
  • A role that directly contributes to the improvement of global healthcare outcomes


How to Apply

Please combine your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and language skills into a single document and submit it via the LinkedIn "CV upload" option.


Equal Opportunity Statement

We are all proud to work for such a great company as Samantree Medical. And we would be even prouder to have you on board. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, regardless of your race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Please apply if you see a position that makes your heartbeat, and if you feel the role is appealing to you. If you’re smart and good at what you do, come as you are.

SamanTree is an emerging company with significant potential in the MedTech sector. For individuals seeking challenges, SamanTree offers opportunities for growth both nationally and internationally. We value inquisitive and highly committed individuals who are dedicated to collaborating towards making SamanTree a success.


Join a team that’s setting new standards for healthcare professionals and their patients worldwide. Together, let’s transform the future of Intra Operative Margin Assessment with the Histolog Scanner.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‘art of the possible’.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team’s solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team’s velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Spacewise is an innovative B2B SaaS proptech company headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, with a rapidly expanding presence. Spacewise is revolutionizing the way commercial real estate landlords market, manage, and monetize their portfolios and spaces online to supercharge the value of their consumer facing properties. Spacewise also operates the premier online marketplace for short-term, pop-up, and promotional spaces.




For landlords, we provide user-friendly software tools to digitize property and space inventory for seamless space marketing and management. Our platform is trusted by major organizations such as Regency Centers and Centennial in North America; and Migros, Coop, SBB, Swiss Post, and Wincasa in Europe, just to name a few. Furthermore, we enable lead generation and booking activities for many of the world’s most renowned brands. Tenants of all sizes use our platform to effortlessly search, evaluate, and book the perfect location for their marketing activations, events, pop-ups, and promotions.




Are you passionate about digital transformation and helping to shape the future of one of the biggest asset classes in the world? Do you like working in an innovative, fast-paced environment? If so, the role as Data Scientist at Spacewise could be the perfect opportunity for you.


Tasks



Develop predictive models and algorithms that analyze various data inputs, including location intelligence, foot traffic, and economic trends, to improve decision-making processes.


Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, and business) to integrate machine learning models and data insights into the product ecosystem.


Identify, collect, and analyze relevant data sources to deliver insights that enhance property pricing strategies, space utilization, and tenant matching.


Create and refine forecasting models to predict future trends and outcomes, such as foot traffic patterns, sales potential, and space demand.


Perform exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling to understand key business drivers and deliver actionable recommendations.


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines to enable real-time analytics and reporting.


Communicate complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, contributing to the strategic direction of the company.



Requirements



Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.


Proven experience in building machine learning models and algorithms, preferably within the real estate, retail, or spatial analytics domains.Strong proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Pandas, Matplotlib).


Experience working with large datasets and applying statistical techniques such as regression, clustering, and time-series analysis.Familiarity with location-based analytics and spatial data, including the use of geospatial data for forecasting and analysis.


Experience developing pricing algorithms or revenue management systems is a strong plus.Ability to communicate complex concepts clearly to both technical and business teams.


Familiarity with cloud-based platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure for data storage and analysis.


Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.





Preferred Qualifications:





Experience with recommendation systems or personalization algorithms.


Knowledge of optimization techniques for pricing and inventory management.


Familiarity with foot traffic data, sales potential forecasting, and revenue optimization strategies in commercial spaces.



Benefits



Competitive salary and benefits package.


Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment at the intersection of real estate and technology.


Remote-friendly workplace with flexible working hours.


Growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling company.





Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you're a good fit for this role.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




SII Group is a trusted technology partner, SII provides high value added solutions for the IT projects of many large corporations. Since its founding in 1979, the Company has been providing solutions adapted to its clients’ needs, by relying on :




> Its acknowledged expertise in various industries and sectors

> Proven 'turnkey' solutions

> An efficient quality system

> Adaptable, evolving services




Today, with a staff of more than 18'000, SII Group is supporting companies across 20 countries.




At SII Switzerland we pay attention to the personal and professional wellbeing of our employees. We place our collaborators at the heart of our actions and activities. If you are motivated by the perspective of joining a big, trusted and recognized group, then let's meet !




To develop our consulting offer and support one of our clients, we are looking for a talented Data Scientist / Data Analyst.







Missions




Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.







Profil




5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.







Informations complémentaires




Date de début : dès que possible
Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
Durée : Long terme
Langue : Français et anglais
Nationalité européenne requise

Title: Optimization Data Scientist
Description:
Contexte et environnement

Your mission

As part of the Optimization Services team, you will design, develop, deploy and support the Data Science models of the team’s systems/applications.

The Optimization Services team focuses on the multi-market multi-asset optimizations of short-term power trading. We are part of the Gas & Power IT department for the Trading business lines of the TotalEnergies company, whose main office is in Geneva with a presence on other continents (Singapore, Houston, Dubaï, etc.).

TotalEnergies Gas & Power Trading (TGP) and its affiliates has a large and complex systems environment, which is evolving with the expansion of the power trading business and its impact on trading IT. To accompany these evolutions, the Optimization Services team participates in a significant change program that will have notable impacts both on the short-term and the long-term. In this context, the team is leveraging Data Science and Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP.

This role is global and focuses on the tools used by the front office and the integration into the overall energy management systems. The continuation of the systems performance, availability, and resilience, as well as scalability, need to be assured.

Activités

What You Will Do

Your focus will be on the Data Science models of the Optimization Service’s team applications. A significant part of these models will be based on Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP. You will interact mainly with the team’s Business Analysts, Data Scientists and Back-end Developers.

Analyze:


Understand the business context and specifications
Analyze the technical and functional feasibility
Participate in the design authority processes



Produce:


Design, develop and deploy new functionalities according to business needs
Ensure the proper functioning of the deliverable through monitoring and testing
Ensure the models are seamlessly integrated in the related applications
Implement the adequate balance between model precision and computation complexity
Adjust the deliverables based on feedback
Ensure adherence to best practice, guidelines and procedures for development, test and deployment
Maintain compliance of development and related activities with audit, cybersecurity and other internal requirements



Run & Change:


Improve the existing applications based on business needs and priorities
Participate in the support of the existing applications



Communicate:


Collaborate with Back-end Developers to integrate features and ensure interoperability
Provide technical support and assistance to Business Analysts and other contributors for specifications, testing and the resolution of incidents / problems
Document the codes as well as the algorithms to facilitate maintenance and knowledge transfer
Ensure and maintain effective interactions with other relevant teams
Contribute to the community of Data Scientists



Profil du candidat

We expect you to have:


A Data Scientist / Optimization Expert background with a proficiency in software development
Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
Proficiency in Python and its good practices
Interest for the power trading business
An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline



It would be a plus if you had:


Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
Experience in a power utility or trading environment
Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
Experience with Databricks
Experience in Cloud-based environments



Your strengths

You are…


Able to solve complex problems
Rigorous
A Team player
Curious and open-minded
Dynamic and agile
Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views



Languages


English : C1 level as minimum expectation
Competency in French is advantageous



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more

  • Provide technical support and assistance to Business Analysts and other contributors for specifications, testing and the resolution of incidents / problems
  • Document the codes as well as the algorithms to facilitate maintenance and knowledge transfer
  • Ensure and maintain effective interactions with other relevant teams
  • Contribute to the community of Data Scientists


Profil du candidat

We expect you to have:

  • A Data Scientist / Optimization Expert background with a proficiency in software development
  • Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
  • Proficiency in Python and its good practices
  • Interest for the power trading business
  • An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
  • Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline


It would be a plus if you had:

  • Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
  • Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
  • Experience in a power utility or trading environment
  • Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
  • Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
  • Experience with Databricks
  • Experience in Cloud-based environments


Your strengths

You are…

  • Able to solve complex problems
  • Rigorous
  • A Team player
  • Curious and open-minded
  • Dynamic and agile
  • Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views


Languages

  • English : C1 level as minimum expectation
  • Competency in French is advantageous


Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
THIS JOB IS NOT A REMOTE JOB. WORK ONSITE IS OBLIGATORY.




Snapbau is a digital purchasing management platform used by more than 320 construction companies in Switzerland, including major players such as Orllati, CPSA, Scrasa and ARSA. Our solution automates and optimises the management of calls for tender and purchasing, enabling companies to save time, reduce errors and centralise collaboration with suppliers.




You will be part of the team responsible for designing and building the AI layer of Snapbau’s digital operating system for procurement and coordination in the construction sector.


Tasks


AI System Design & Development





Develop machine learning and AI models to automate and optimize construction procurement workflows (e.g. price prediction, document classification, lead scoring, supplier matching).


Build generative AI features to assist with document generation, meeting summaries, and structured communication.


Create and maintain pipelines for training, testing, and deploying ML models.


Develop lightweight APIs or services to integrate AI modules into the Snapbau platform.





Data Engineering & Management





Work closely with backend developers to structure, clean, and extract usable data from various sources (e.g. supplier databases, project histories, tender documents).


Apply construction-specific taxonomies (e.g. eBKP-H, CRB) to enable structured, domain-relevant decision-making.


Improve model performance through effective feature engineering based on our domain data.





Product Integration





Collaborate with product managers and frontend developers to design and implement AI-powered tools for end users.


Ensure AI components are integrated into Snapbau’s user experience in a fast, reliable, and intuitive way.


Monitor model performance post-deployment and adjust based on feedback and new data.





Strategy & Innovation





Contribute to Snapbau’s long-term AI architecture and roadmap.


Stay updated on advancements in applied AI (LLMs, computer vision, agent workflows, etc.) and evaluate their relevance for construction tech.


Help define AI-related hiring, tooling, and infrastructure needs as the team scales.



Requirements



Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models (especially NLP, classification, recommendation, or price prediction).


Strong programming skills in Python; familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, FastAPI.


Experience building and maintaining ML pipelines.


Familiarity with REST APIs and integrating ML models into production environments.


Solid understanding of data wrangling and structuring from messy or unstructured sources.


Knowledge of or willingness to learn domain-specific standards such as eBKP-H or CRB is a strong plus.


Experience working in fast-paced, cross-functional product teams.


Ability to work autonomously while contributing to a strategic, long-term vision.





Join Snapbau if you want to shape how AI transforms the future of construction procurement. This role offers high impact, deep technical ownership, and a direct path into one of the most overlooked but critical sectors of the real economy.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist is responsible for leading the design, development, and implementation of advanced data models, machine learning algorithms, and statistical analyses. This role aims to drive strategic decision-making and solve high-impact business challenges across various functions. The Senior Data Scientist will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop solutions, integrate insights, and optimize business outcomes.

The role requires a deep understanding of data science principles, strong analytical skills, and proficiency in machine learning techniques. It also involves working on data wrangling, exploratory analysis, and model deployment, with a focus on achieving production-ready AI/ML solutions that are aligned with business goals.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop End-to-End Data Science Projects: Lead data science initiatives from business exploration and model prototyping to deployment and performance monitoring.
Data Collection and Integration: Collect and integrate data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and cloud platforms, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean, preprocess, and validate datasets to ensure they meet quality standards for analysis.
Model Development: Design and develop predictive models and AI systems to optimize manufacturing operations, enable predictive maintenance, and improve supply chain logistics.
Collaboration: Work closely with engineering teams and business stakeholders to ensure that AI/ML solutions are aligned with business objectives and production-ready.
Communication: Effectively communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences through reports, visualizations, and dashboards.
Continuous Learning: Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and best practices in data science and artificial intelligence, ensuring that the organization remains on the cutting edge of technology.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in data science or a related field, with expertise in machine learning, statistical analysis, and model deployment.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and experimental design.
Hands-on experience with data wrangling and model development.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and model deployment in different infrastructures.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams to achieve business goals.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs, approximately 15 %

Title: Data Scientist With Azure AI
Description:
OneAPPS Consulting (www.oneapps.com) is a Technology consulting firm based out of Zurich, Switzerland and offices across Europe. We are working on various projects involving diverse, multicultural teams with clients across the Europe. We are an invaluable partner and our teams have collaborated to support the growth of our clients. With more than 7 locations worldwide we help our clients to deliver their projects smoothly. We look forward to getting to know you and working with you.




Data Scientist with focus on engineering AI solutions with Microsoft Azure

Location: Zurich




Data Engineering: Expertise in data preprocessing, data wrangling, and building data pipelines to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Azure Machine Learning Services: Familiarity with Azure Machine Learning Studio, Azure Databricks, and other Azure AI services for building, training, and deploying machine learning models.

Big Data Technologies: Experience with big data tools and technologies such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Azure Synapse Analytics for handling large datasets.

Cloud Computing: Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, including Azure infrastructure, storage solutions, and cloud security best practices.

Data Visualization and Communication: Ability to visualize data insights using tools like Power BI and effectively communicate findings to stakeholders.




If this role sounds like you, we invite you to apply. Thanks.

Due to work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss Nationals, UK, EU citizens as well as relevant work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Title: AI Developer m/f/d (50 % - 70%), Lucerne
Description:
Doing the right thing. We are active in Switzerland and 20 countries on four continents. Join us with a commitment to help us bring about a more caring society, as

AI Developer m/f/d (50 % - 70%), Lucerne

Our team drives innovation by harnessing data, automation, and artificial intelligence to optimize business processes and enable data-driven decision-making. With expertise in data science, business analysis, and process automation, we develop intelligent solutions that support the digital transformation of our organization.

To strengthen our team we are looking for an AI Developer (m/f/d). In this role, you will significantly influencing the technological future of our organization.

Your duties


Development of AI solutions/ML models
Test, deploy and maintain AI systems
Collaborate with data scientists and other engineers to integrate AI into broader system architecture
Stay current with AI trends and suggest improvements to existing systems and workflows


Our requirements


Knowledge and interest of ML/AI techniques
Proficiency in Python programming and Github
Excellent problem-solving skills and analytical thinking
Managing data flow and infrastructure for effective AI deployment
Collaboration across teams to align AI initiatives with organizational goals
Excellent communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, AI and other related fields
Hand-on experience implementing AI projects
Machine Learning or AI course certificates


Your place of work will be Lucerne.

Starting date: 01.08.2025 or as agreed upon

Caritas offers attractive working conditions and an open working atmosphere in an international field of activities. For the active development and implementation of the digital transformation, we count on employees with a digital and agile mindset who are keen to participate in processes of change.

For further information please contact: Ms Harry Witzthum, Head of Digital transformation & KI, Telephone +41 41 419 22 22.

Thank you for your interest. We look forward to receiving your job application by 11.08.2025 latest through our web portal.

Caritas Switzerland, Adligenswilerstrasse 15, 6002 Lucerne

www.caritas.ch

Title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineer
Description:
Application period 14-Jul-2025 to 15-Aug-2025

Functional Responsibilities:

Under the supervision of the UNOPS Project Manager and in close collaboration with IAH, the AI Engineer will perform the following key functions: 2. AI solution integration with an enterprise data architecture 3. Responsible AI & Risk Management


Development of AI agents and custom Copilot-based end-to-end solutions
Implement custom Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines with vector search and document intelligence.
Build function calling capabilities to trigger real-time backend services or frontend actions.
Develop agentic AI systems that can reason, orchestrate multi-step tasks, and generate responses dynamically.
Design AI solutions with Model Context Protocol to enable multi-step reasoning, memory retrieval, and agent-to-agent continuity.
Engineer secure and scalable integrations between AI systems, OHCHR’s Data Foundation (Fabric/OneLake), APIs, and application layers.
Build and deliver the OHCHR Data as a Service project, including AI-driven querying and interactive data visualization triggers.
Use Azure AI Foundry and other orchestration tools to build multi-model, composable AI solutions.
Develop and maintain APIs, microservices, and frontend code (JavaScript/React/Next.js) to support AI capabilities.
Perform hands-on evaluation, testing, and benchmarking of AI models and frameworks across providers (Microsoft Azure/OpenAI, Google, AWS, open-source).
Lead the implementation of red teaming, validation, and testing pipelines for AI solution safety, compliance, and robustness.



Education/Experience/Language requirements:

*FEMALE CANDIDATES ARE STRONGLY ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

*CANDIDATES WITH NO UNITED NATIONS OR UNOPS EXPERIENCE ARE STRONGLY ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

Education


Advanced university degree (Master’s degree or equivalent) preferably in computer science, information systems, data science, data analytics, or in a field related to the post description with five (5) years of relevant experience is required; OR
A first-level university degree (Bachelor’s degree or equivalent) preferably in computer science, information systems, data science, data analytics, or in a field related to the post description with seven (7) years of relevant experience is desirable.



Work Experience

Required:


Relevant experience is defined as experience building multimodal RAG systems, function calling, and AI agent orchestration.
Experience with AI context protocols, including prompt engineering, memory retrieval, and building agentic systems capable of context-aware reasoning and actions is required
Deep hands-on expertise in Python (FastAPI, LangChain, Azure AI services), Nodejs, and JavaScript/TypeScript (React, Next.js) is required
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure (Azure AI Foundry, Fabric/OneLake, API Management) and/or ability to work across multiple AI providers is required
Solid background in cloud architecture, secure APIs, identity (Entra ID), and governance is required
Ability to deliver working code, AI models, and deployed solutions independently and efficiently is required



Desirable:


Familiarity with digital product development, agile methodologies, or human-centered design is an asset.
Awareness of AI ethics, responsible AI, and human rights considerations is desirable
Experience working with or within the UN system or similar international organization is desirable.



Language


Fluency in English (read, write, speak) is required.
Knowledge of French is desirable.
Knowledge of another UN official language is an advantage.


Think big. Meet challenges head-on. Help people build better lives.
UNOPS embraces diversity and is committed to equal employment opportunities. Our workforce is made up of people from varied nationalities, cultures and races. They speak a range of languages and have different gender identities, sexual orientations, and abilities.
We encourage women and candidates from underrepresented groups in UNOPS to apply. These include candidates from racialized and/or indigenous groups, members of minority gender identities and sexual orientations, and people with disabilities. Click apply and join us!

Remarks: Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Project Description:

We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement advanced machine learning and deep learning models tailored to complex financial datasets and business objectives.
Apply statistical and mathematical methods to analyze data trends, assess risk, and inform predictive modeling.
Evaluate, validate, and monitor model performance, ensuring accuracy, stability, and regulatory compliance.
Collaborate with financial analysts, IT teams, and data scientists to align models with operational and strategic goals.
Translate technical results into actionable insights through clear visualizations and communication to non-technical stakeholders.
Stay current on evolving financial regulations, market developments, and innovations in AI applications for the banking sector.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and linear algebra, essential for developing interpretable and robust models.
Deep expertise in Python and R, with hands-on experience using libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Solid understanding of financial markets, instruments, and regulatory frameworks, enabling informed model development and deployment.
Proven ability to evaluate and validate models for fairness, accuracy, and real-world relevance.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with experience presenting to business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience with deep learning frameworks, NLP, and time-series forecasting in financial contexts is highly desirable.




Languages:

English: C1 Advanced

Title: Tools Programmer
Description:
To strengthen our programming team, we are looking for a




Tools Programmer




based in Zurich, Switzerland.




Job Responsibilities

Developing and improving internal software tools to support production workflows
Maintaining and enhancing existing tools and pipelines
Collaborating with other teams to understand and address their specific requirements
Actively programming and implementing solutions for the majority of the role




Expected Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering or a related field (Master’s degree is a plus)
At least three years of experience as a tools programmer or software engineer
Very strong C++ knowledge and experience in multithreaded programming
Strong focus on usability and workflows
Passion for gaming and a strong interest in the industry
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to analyze and understand user needs
Good knowledge of English, both written and spoken




What would be a plus?

Previous experience in the gaming industry
Familiarity with GUI design and LUA scripting
Basic linear algebra knowledge




What do we offer?

Variety: Challenging, creative projects with ample room for innovation
Work-life Balance: Flexible hours to accommodate effective working styles
Inclusivity: open, collaborative atmosphere with flat hierarchies & open doors
Company Growth: we’re a young, diverse, successful, and growing company
Personal Development: individual opportunities for professional growth
Modern Workspace: up-to-date hardware & software solutions
Top location: central office with excellent public transport links
Stability & Perks: Permanent employment, attractive salary, bonuses
Extras: Complimentary drinks, snacks and fruit, team-building events




To apply for this position, please send us a resume and a cover letter.

  • Inclusivity: open, collaborative atmosphere with flat hierarchies & open doors
  • Company Growth: we’re a young, diverse, successful, and growing company
  • Personal Development: individual opportunities for professional growth
  • Modern Workspace: up-to-date hardware & software solutions
  • Top location: central office with excellent public transport links
  • Stability & Perks: Permanent employment, attractive salary, bonuses
  • Extras: Complimentary drinks, snacks and fruit, team-building events


To apply for this position, please send us a resume and a cover letter.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement data engineering solutions, including preprocessing, wrangling, and pipeline orchestration to ensure high data quality and reliability.
Build, train, and deploy machine learning models using Azure tools such as Machine Learning Studio, Databricks, and Azure AI services.
Manage and optimize workflows for big data processing using technologies like Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
Collaborate with engineering and analytics teams to develop scalable AI systems within the Azure cloud ecosystem.
Ensure solutions adhere to cloud security best practices, data governance, and compliance standards.
Communicate complex data findings through impactful visualizations and storytelling using Power BI and similar tools.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong experience in data engineering, with proficiency in building robust pipelines and transforming raw data into analytics-ready formats.
Hands-on expertise with Microsoft Azure AI services, including Machine Learning Studio, Databricks, and related tooling.
Familiarity with big data technologies, particularly Apache Spark, Hadoop, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
In-depth knowledge of cloud computing principles, especially within Azure infrastructure (e.g., storage, networking, identity, and security).
Proficient in data visualization and communication using Power BI, with the ability to clearly articulate insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities, with a solution-oriented and collaborative mindset.

Title: Data Scientist, GeminiApp, Personalization
Description:
About The Team

Our team, GeminiApp, is on a mission to build a universal AI assistant that will empower billions of people. We are creating a personal, proactive, and powerful life assistant that will be used multiple times a day to increase productivity and creativity by 10 to 100-fold. Our work is shaping how humanity interacts with AI at scale.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist on the GeminiApp team, you are a key partner and co-creator in our product strategy. You will be instrumental in building a uniquely proactive and powerful assistant by ensuring our strategic decisions are grounded in data. This is a high-impact role for a data scientist who is excited about working in a fast-paced, innovative environment and who is passionate about building user-centered experiences that will redefine our relationship with technology.

What You’ll Do


Partner with product, engineering, and UX to develop data-driven product strategies
Translate ambiguous questions into well-defined problems, design experiments, and analyze large complex datasets for insights
Develop and implement novel, goal-oriented metrics
Build and deploy statistical/ML models to understand our users, enhance product capabilities and personalize user experience
Communicate findings & recommendations to stakeholders, including executives
Champion data-driven culture by feeding user engagement insights back into models
Collaborate with the GenAI team on model quality and feature adoption
Act as a technical leader for the local team, guiding junior members on complex analyses and upholding best practices to ensure high-quality, impactful work


What We're Looking For


A bias for action and a relentless drive to build something great. You are a resourceful and creative problem-solver, able to find innovative solutions in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You are comfortable with ambiguity and thrive on a challenge.
Strong business acumen and a strategic mindset. You have a proven ability to connect data-driven insights to business impact and can effectively translate business needs into data science problems.
Deep technical expertise. You have a strong foundation in statistical modeling, machine learning, and experimental design. You are proficient in SQL and have hands-on experience with a programming language like Python or R.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills. You can articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences, including executive leadership. You are a compelling storyteller who can use data to influence decisions.
A collaborative and influential partner. You have a track record of successfully collaborating with and influencing cross-functional teams, particularly engineering and product management, to drive data-informed decisions. You are ready to work in an environment with a shared roadmap that holds multiple teams accountable for both model quality and feature adoption.
A commitment to user trust and privacy. You understand the importance of telling users what data is being used and why, and you are committed to providing users with granular, easy-to-understand controls over their personal information.


Why You'll Love Working Here


Impact: You'll have a direct and meaningful impact on a product designed to empower billions of people and be one of the greatest forces for good in the world.
Growth: We're a fast-growing team within Google, and you'll have the opportunity to evolve quickly to meet changing user needs.
Team & Culture: You'll work with a talented and passionate team of people who are excited about what they do and have fun doing it.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field.
8 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, performing statistical analysis, and coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL).


At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Application deadline: 12pm GMT Thursday 11th August 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see ourApplicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
About the Role

A student is seeking a beginner-level AI engineer to support a part-time, remote project focused on helping bring top-tier instructors onboard through AI-driven solutions. The role involves assisting in the development or implementation of tools or systems that can streamline the identification and recruitment of qualified educators. The project is connected to Lead Academy and offers an excellent opportunity for an emerging AI practitioner to contribute to a meaningful educational initiative while gaining valuable real-world experience.

Requirements

Basic knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning principles
Familiarity with Python and common AI libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or similar
Ability to support simple AI-driven processes such as candidate filtering, ranking, or data analysis
Willingness to learn and collaborate on a project aimed at improving educational access
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Remote availability and responsiveness to communication
Suitable for beginners looking to build experience through a part-time contract role

About Twine

Twine is a leading marketplace connecting top freelancers, consultants, and contractors with companies needing creative and tech expertise.

Our Mission

Twine's mission is to empower creators and businesses to thrive in an AI-driven, freelance-first world.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.




We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.




🚀 Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!


Tasks



Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.


Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.


Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.


Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.


Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.


Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.



Requirements



Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.


Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.


Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.


Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.


Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.


Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.


Fluent in English (German is a plus).



Benefits



Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.


Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).


Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.


Competitive salary & benefits.


Collaboration with AI & cloud experts shaping the future of AI.





Pixel Plus is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist Stellendetails | Schweizerische Nationalbank
HTML:
Die Schweizerische Nationalbank (SNB) führt als unabhängige Zentralbank die Geldpolitik im Gesamtinteresse des Landes. Sie sorgt für Preisstabilität und trägt damit zu einem Umfeld bei, in dem sich die Volkswirtschaft gut entwickeln kann.

_____

 Data Scientist ( 60% - 80%)

Die Organisationseinheit Analysen Operatives Bankgeschäft fokussiert auf die Erleichterung und Sicherung des Funktionierens von bargeldlosen Zahlungssystemen. Im Fokus steht die Ausgestaltung des SIC-Systems, unter anderem mit den Themen Zugang, Weiterentwicklung und Sicherheit. Dazu werden konzeptionelle und empirische Arbeiten durchgeführt. Im Bereich empirischer Arbeiten werden grosse Datensammlungen bewirtschaftet und mit fortgeschrittener statistischer Methodik analysiert. Arbeitsort: Zürich

Ihr Beitrag:


  • Auswertung und Unterhalt grosser Datensammlungen zum bargeldlosen Zahlungsverkehr;
  • Weiterentwicklung des datengestützten Reportings sowie der Analyseinfrastruktur;
  • Leitung von Projekten an der Schnittstelle zwischen Fach und IT;
  • Entwicklung von Anwendungen zur Analyse hochdimensionaler Zahlungsverkehrsdaten;
  • Aktive Mitwirkung bei der Umsetzung der bankweiten Data-Science-Strategie.


Ihre Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen:


  • Master oder Doktorat in einem quantitativen Fachgebiet;
  • Berufserfahrung in der Analyse grosser Datensätze mit datenwissenschaftlichen Methoden;
  • Ausgewiesene Kenntnisse zu Datenbankmanagement, Scripting-Sprachen (R, Python), Analyseinfrastruktur wie Cloudera oder Posit, Datenvisualisierung;
  • Erfahrungen in der Projektleitung, idealerweise im Gebiet Data Science;
  • Grosses Interesse an notenbankspezifischen Themen und dem bargeldlosen Zahlungsverkehr;
  • Hohe Sozialkompetenz, sicheres Auftreten, Verantwortungsbewusstsein und ausgeprägte Kooperations- und Teamfähigkeit;
  • Sichere Kommunikation auf Deutsch oder Französisch sowie auf Englisch.


Unser Angebot:

Wir bieten eine verantwortungsvolle und herausfordernde Tätigkeit in einem kollegialen Umfeld und einer Organisation, die Sie beruflich wie auch persönlich fördert. Unsere Arbeitsbedingungen sind modern und unterstützen die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben. Dazu gehört die Möglichkeit, flexibel und im Home-Office zu arbeiten.

Die SNB achtet die unterschiedlichen Bedürfnisse und Lebenserfahrungen ihrer Mitarbeitenden und fördert deren Vielfalt. Chancengleichheit und Gleichbehandlung haben höchste Priorität. Unsere Entlöhnung ist fair, markt- und leistungsgerecht.

Weitere Informationen finden Sie auf unserer Homepage: Schweizerische Nationalbank (SNB) - Arbeitgeberin SNB .

Wir freuen uns darauf, Sie kennen zu lernen. Senden Sie uns Ihr komplettes Bewerbungsdossier mit Motivationsschreiben über unser Online Bewerbungstool.

Schweizerische Nationalbank

Human Resources | Katrin Kuster

www.snb.ch

Title: Applied AI Research Scientist
Description:
On behalf of our client Hilo by Aktiia, and as part of an exclusive mandate, we are seeking a versatile and motivated individual to join their pioneering team as a




APPLIED AI RESEARCH SCIENTIST 100%




Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges




Your profile

Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Strong publication record in Machine Learning or AI
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.)
Experience in time series analysis is a MUST.
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Motivated, proactive, and curious, with a structured, solution-oriented mindset; a team player eager to learn
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit




Benefits

Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)







Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?




Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Title: Data Scientist (H/F) - LHH
Description:
Nous recrutons un ou une Data Scientist (H/F) pour renforcer le département IT de notre client situé à Genève, Si vous êtes prêt ou prête à relever un nouveau défi, cette offre est pour vous.

Responsabilités:

En tant que Data Scientist vous élaborez, entraîner et mettez en oeuvre des modèles de machine learning. De plus, vous exploitez et valorisez des données (internes/externes) afin de générez des analyses poussées et des prédictions fiables. Vous collaborez principalement avec des analystes et des interlocuteurs métier. Vous participez à la mise en production, à la supervision et à l'optimisation des modèles. Vous contribuez à la feuille de route IA

Profil:


Bachelor en IT ou équivalent (data science/statistique/mathématiques)
Entre 2 et 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist (bancaire, un plus)
Expérience en déploiement de solutions IA bancaire
Excellentes connaissances de Python (scikit-learn, Pandas, TensorFlow)
Bonnes connaissances bases de données relationnelles et non relationnelles SQL/NoSQL)
Bonnes connaissances Versioning (Git)
Bonnes connaissances MLFlows, DVC, un plus
Français maternelle obligatoire. Bon niveau d'anglais

Title: AI Specialist - Generative AI, Cloud Engineering, Data Science
Description:
AI Specialist – Generative AI, Cloud Engineering, Data Science




About MDW Partners At MDW Partners, we help organizations unlock the power of data and AI by aligning business strategy with modern data platforms and intelligent solutions. Based in Europe and backed by a strong track record, MDW provides high-value consulting services to leading companies across industries. Our team is composed of experts in data architecture, engineering, analytics, and artificial intelligence. We foster innovation through hands-on experience and a collaborative culture.




We are currently looking for a AI Specialist with a strong background in cloud engineering, data science, and data engineering optionally




Your profile:

4+ years of experience in a similar role
Proficient in developing Generative AI applications
Knowledge of traditional data science (ML, metrics, statistics)
Experience delivering cloud-hosted projects (Azure)
Proficient in using cloud data platforms (Databricks, Fabric)
Proven expertise in transforming complex data and client needs into actionable insights
Client facing experience
Good organizational and time-management skills
Rigorous, result-oriented, and focused on customer needs




Your skills:

Knowledge of Generative AI main applications (Chatbots, process automation, …)
Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with Generative AI, including OpenAI APIs, LangChain, and prompt engineering
Mastery of python (pyspark highly recommended. JS, Typescript is a plus)
Comfortable in backend development (FastAPI)
Knowledge of at least one frontend framework (Streamlit, React, …)
Knowledge of containerized deployment (Docker, cloud hosting)
Strong expertise in statistics for data analysis, modeling, and inference
Strong knowledge of Azure ecosystem (Web App, Data Factory, Synapse, Data Lake gen2, Azure Functions, etc.)
Languages: English & French (mandatory)




Good to have:

Certifications: Azure DP-203, AZ-104, AZ-305; Databricks Data Engineering Associate
Knowledge of IaC tools like Terraform, Bicep, or ARM templates and/or CICD
Experience with Databricks
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric
Experience with data engineering
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps
Experience working in Agile environments
Experience with data modeling and governance tools (e.g., Profisee, Purview)
Experience with networking




Join us to contribute to impactful projects in generative AI or in the general data landscape. You'll be part of a passionate and highly skilled team building scalable solutions that deliver business value.




Apply now or contact us to learn more!
